result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Tanksley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant discharged from probation on 12-15-16 with no unpaid financial obligations
Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.

Defendant Marcus Tanksley in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing recommendations argreed.  Defendant made statement to Court.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 months in jail, with Huber work release.  199 days credit.  All unpaid financial obligations will be entered into a civil judgment.  3:16/3:36

1:17 P.M., Defendant Marcus Tanksley in court, in custody with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties agree defendant is competent, Court finds defendant is competent, Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, 15 FO 200 dismissed, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, $518.00 costs,  Defendant to provide DNA Sample, psychological evaluation and comply with any recommendations, firearms restriction, no contact w/K.P.J., 113 days sentence credit,
Filed by Atty Leonie Dolch, requesting the competency hearing be set to a plea/sentencing hearing.

SPD information given to defendant.  State raised issues of defendants compentency.  Court requested attorney Dolch help defendant apply for SPD.   Court ordered competency evaluation.   Competency hearing will be scheduled after report is back.

Defendant, Marcus Tanksley, appeared by jail video with Attorney Alicia Nall, special for the public defender office. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $300.00 cash bond set with standard felony conditions, no contact K.J., her residence or workplace, not go upon the 600 block of E Howard St., City of Portage.
